Description: Two joining fragments of body of North Ionian black-figured pottery closed vase; glaze fired red-brown; interior reserved; exterior: reserved area at tpop with band with added red line below; below, frieze with a swan and a sphinx, heads reverted, in an antithetical composition; incised 'rosettes' between and to right.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 113, pl. XXXV, no. 324.5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.948)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5995 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
